TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1122
TEI.2.document_title: John P Coles to Stephen F Austin, 06-06-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: John P. Coles to Austin, June 6, 1825. Transmitting census. Saucedo to Austin, June 6, 1825. Austin need not bear the expense of the arrest of Lozoya and guarding his drove of horses. Other criminals.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1122

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*John P. Coles to Austin, June 6, 1825. Transmitting census. Saucedo to Austin, June 6, 1825. Austin need not bear the expense of the arrest of Lozoya and guarding his drove of horses. Other criminals.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="06-06-1825">June 6th 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir*/p*
*p*Inclosed I send you an account of the Census of this *location_mentioned*District */location_mentioned*I have been as correct in it as circumstances would permit you will also find Inclosed the plot of *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*James white*/person_mentioned*s Tract of Land*/location_mentioned* I have not seen any of those *person_mentioned*Phillips*/person_mentioned*'s since I saw you nor neither has *person_mentioned*Keer*/person_mentioned* selected any Land that I know of I have not found the young Mare that was Lost I am fearful that she is Intirely Lost Either stolen or Drownd in attempting to Recross the *location_mentioned*River */location_mentioned*I have sirched for her diligently in Every direction but cannot find her I want to come down shortly*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jno P. Coles */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
